bibl.title: Measuring Sex, Age and Death in the Roman Empire. Explorations in Ancient Demography.

series.title: Journal of Roman Archaeology. Supplementary Series.

bibl.note: 1. The Biology of Brother-sister Marriage in Roman Egypt: An Interdisciplinary Approach. - 2. Digit Preference in Age Records from Roman Egypt. - 3. The Demography of the Roman Imperial Army. - 4. Seasonal Mortality in the Roman Empire. - Afterword. Appendices. Bibliography.
bibl.seg: SCHEIDEL Walter, Measuring Sex, Age and Death in the Roman Empire. Explorations in Ancient Demography. (Journal of Roman Archaeology. Supplementary Series. 21.)
Ann Arbor, Cushing-Malloy, 1996, 4Â°, 184 pp., tabl., graphiques. ISBN 1-887829-21-0.

1. The Biology of Brother-sister Marriage in Roman Egypt: An Interdisciplinary Approach. - 2. Digit Preference in Age Records from Roman Egypt. - 3. The Demography of the Roman Imperial Army. - 4. Seasonal Mortality in the Roman Empire. - Afterword. Appendices. Bibliography.

C.R. par Richard Alston, CR N.S., 49 (1999) pp. 512-514. - Roger S. Bagnall, BMCRev 8 (1997) pp. 871-878. - Dominic Montserrat, BASP 35 (1998) pp. 243-248. - Jean A. Straus, ChrEg 74 (1999) No. 147, pp. 188-190. - Pierre Salmon, Latomus 60 (2001) pp. 530-531. - Manfred Clauss, Klio 83 (2001) pp. 536-537. - Claudia Perassi, Aegyptus 80 (2000 [2002]) pp. 297-300. - Lothar Wierschowski, Gnomon 74 (2002) pp. 555-556.
